stimulusHtml: The reference to “the world revolution” in the excerpt most directly refers to which of the following developments in international affairs following the Second World War?

features.html:
Question refers to the excerpt below.

“I am convinced that if we are to get on the right side of the world revolution, we as a nation must undergo a radical revolution of values. We must rapidly begin...the shift from a thing-oriented society to a person-oriented society. When machines and computers, profit motives and property rights are considered more important than people, the giant triplets of racism, extreme materialism, and militarism are incapable of being conquered.”

Martin Luther King, Jr., “Beyond Vietnam,” April 4, 1967

choicesHtml: Decolonization and the emergence of nationalist movements in Asia and Africa
The beginning of the Cold War in Europe
United States support for anticommunist regimes in Latin America
United States efforts to create a national energy policy
